knimeNode.name: SSH Connector (Labs)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Connects to remote file system by SSH in order to read/write files in downstream nodes.

intro.p: This node connects to remote file system by SSH. The resulting output port allows downstream nodes to access the files of the remote file system, e.g. to read or write, or to perform other file system operations (browse/list files, copy, move, ...).

Path syntax: Paths for SSH are specified with a UNIX-like syntax, /myfolder/myfile. An absolute for SSH consists of:
A leading slash ("/").
Followed by the path to the file ("myfolder/myfile" in the above example).

tab.name: Settings
tab.option:
Method of authentication.
Credentials: workflow credentials authentication.
Username & password: user name and password authentication.
Key file: private key file authentication.
Use workflow credentials to determine user and password.
Password of the user of remote file system
File system where known hosts file is placed on.
Location of the keyfile. Note that the key file has to be in OpenSSH key file format.

Specify the working directory of the resulting file system connection, using the Path syntax explained above. The working directory must be specified as an absolute path. A working directory allows downstream nodes to access files/folders using relative paths, i.e. paths that do not have a leading slash. The default working directory is the root "/", under which all the document libraries are located.
